New Records: Charlie Blackmon's three RBIs were his most in a game since May 27.
Ezequiel Tovar's NL-leading 45th double of the season was the catalyst of a five-run eighth inning for the Rockies.
Key Match Events: The Rockies came back with a five-run eighth inning to win 10-8.
Ryan McMahon's double to right field brought home Tovar for the eventual winning run.
Pre-Game Insights: The Rockies will need to win two out of three games against the Los Angeles Dodgers this weekend to avoid the second 100-loss season in the franchise's 31-year history.
Charlie Blackmon's father threw out the game's ceremonial first pitch, a strike.
Post-Match Reflections: Blackmon said he'd like to enjoy these last three games and remember as much as he can.
Cardinals manager Oliver Marmol said Fernandez has to get you to Hels (MLB saves leader Ryan Helsley) and unfortunately, it didn’t work out for him today.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Paul Goldschmidt hit his 22nd home run of the season, a 457-foot solo shot to center field in the first inning.
Pedro Pagés and Ivan Herrera also homered for the Cardinals.
